data.title: About — Jennifer Rappaport
data.text:
Education

Rhode Island School of Design, Providence, RI — Bachelor of Fine Arts

September 2008 - May 2012

School of Visual Arts, New York — Master of Fine Arts

September 2018 - May 2020

Art Residencies

Kibbutz Contemporary Dance Company Summer Intensive (KCDC); Ga’aton, Israel — 2019

Art Kibbutz: International Jewish Art Residency; Governors Island, New York, NY — 2016

Painting and Mixed Media Residency, School of Visual Arts; New York, NY — 2015

Scholarship Awarded Painting Residency, Vermont Studio Center; Johnson, VT — 2014

Art Exhibitions (Participating artist)

“Parallels”, School of Visual Arts; New York, NY (curator E. Piltzman) — 2020

“Solidarity Auction”, Please Don’t Come To This Show, digital platform (curators Elise Warfield and Daniel Almeida) — 2020

“We Interrupt This Program...”, MFA Thesis Exhibition, School of Visual Arts; New York, NY (curator Regine Basha) — 2020

“Featured Artist”, HBO series, High Maintenance, Season 4; New York, NY — 2020

“Sentimental“ album cover artwork for musician Sam O’Dorazio; New York, NY — 2020

“Object and Reflex”, School of Visual Arts; New York, NY (curator E. Peltzman) — 2019

Open Call, Judson Memorial Church; New York, NY — 2019

“Magic Plastic Lounge”, Satellite Art Fair; Miami, FL — 2018

“Head, The Factory”; Long Island City, NY (curator Tessa Kennedy) — 2017

“Art Hearts Fashion; New York Fashion Week, New York, Ny — 2016

“Open16”, Front Art Space; New York, NY (curator Marina Gluckman) — 2015

“Color”, Brooklyn Water Front Artist Coalition; Brooklyn, NY (curator Lilian Tone) —2014

“Flesh & Bone: Figure Painting”, Hillyer Art Space; Washington, DC — 2014

“Solo Exhibition: Sitting On The Bus I Kept Thinking I Needed a Shower After a Weekend Like That”, Giacometti Paul Gallery; Brooklyn, NY —2014

“Bound”, Women’s Caucus for Art; New York, NY (curator Cora Rosevear) — 2013

“Picture This!”, Danforth Museum; Framingham, MA (curator Cathryn Mercier) —2012

Speaking Engagements & Curatorial Projects

Remarks with Palm Springs Art Museum Associate Curator of Modern and Contemporary Art, Sharrissa Iqbal, for artist panel “Climate Futures”, Hans Baumann, Lauren Bon, Christian Rodriguez, and Debra Scacco; Palm Springs, CA — 2024

Thesis Lecture, School of Visual Art; New York, NY — 2020

Curatorial Project, “Court”, ArtLot; Brooklyn, NY —2019

Artist Talk, School of Visual Art, New York, NY — 2018
